system: You are an expert world-builder for a RuneScape-style MMORPG. Create rich, cohesive lore that enhances the game world and provides context for quests, locations, and characters.

world_history.name: World History
world_history.template: Create historical lore about {{time_period}} in {{world_name}}. Include major events, key figures, and how it shaped the present.

examples.description: A cataclysmic conflict where gods walked the earth and reshaped the world with their battles.

location_lore.name: Location Lore
location_lore.template: Create lore for {{location_name}}, explaining its history, significance, and current state.

examples.lore: Founded centuries ago as a mining settlement, Varrock grew into a bustling trade hub and center of military power.

character_backstory.name: Character Backstory
character_backstory.template: Create backstory for {{character_name}}, explaining their origins, motivations, and how they became who they are.

examples.backstory: Once an adventurer who saved kingdoms, now he shares wisdom with a new generation of heroes.

faction_lore.name: Faction Lore
faction_lore.template: Create lore for {{faction_name}}, including their beliefs, goals, history, and relationships with other factions.

examples.lore: An elite organization that trains and certifies heroes, ensuring they uphold the highest standards of heroism.

item_lore.name: Item Lore
item_lore.template: Create lore for {{item_name}}, explaining its creation, powers, and significance in the world.

examples.lore: Forged during the God Wars from the shards of divine power, this blade can channel the strength of the gods themselves.

creature_lore.name: Creature Lore
creature_lore.template: Create lore for {{creature_type}}, explaining their origins, behavior, and role in the ecosystem.

examples.lore: Ancient beings of immense power, dragons were created by the gods as guardians of sacred treasures and knowledge.

magic_system.name: Magic System Lore
magic_system.template: Create lore explaining {{magic_type}} and how it works in the world.

examples.lore: Magic channeled through ancient runes carved by the Elder Gods. Each rune embodies a fundamental force of nature.

mythology.name: Mythology & Legends
mythology.template: Create a myth or legend about {{topic}} that exists in the world's folklore.

examples.story: They say the mountains were formed when a titan fell asleep and became stone over eons.

themes.heroism: Stories of bravery, sacrifice, and standing against evil
themes.tragedy: Fallen heroes, lost civilizations, mistakes with consequences
themes.mystery: Unsolved puzzles, ancient secrets, hidden truths
themes.redemption: Villains seeking forgiveness, second chances, hope
themes.ambition: The drive for power, discovery, or greatness
themes.corruption: How power corrupts, the price of dark deals
themes.legacy: What we leave behind, living up to ancestors
themes.balance: Order vs chaos, nature vs civilization, light vs dark

consistency_elements.magic_prevalence: Common but respected, magical items are valuable
consistency_elements.divine_presence: Gods exist but rarely intervene directly
consistency_elements.racial_diversity: Multiple races coexist with varying relationships
consistency_elements.mortality: Death is significant, resurrection is rare/difficult
consistency_elements.scale: Epic but personal - heroes can make a difference

connectionPoints.quests: How does this lore tie into playable quests?
connectionPoints.locations: What places in the game relate to this lore?
connectionPoints.items: Are there items connected to this lore?
connectionPoints.npcs: Which NPCs know or are affected by this lore?
connectionPoints.skills: Does this lore explain any game skills or mechanics?

schema.title: string (lore entry title)
schema.discovery_method: string (how players learn this, if discoverable)

guidelines: Maintain consistency with existing game lore
Leave room for mystery - don't explain everything
Connect new lore to existing elements when possible
Make lore discoverable through quests and exploration
Balance epic scope with personal stories
Include hooks for future content and quests
Make lore relevant to player experience
Create depth without requiring PhD to understand
writing_tips: Use evocative language that fits the fantasy setting
Include sensory details to make lore vivid
Create memorable names for people, places, and events
Add human elements - emotions, conflicts, relationships
Include both triumph and tragedy for emotional range
Reference lore naturally in dialogue and quest text
Create layered lore - surface level and deeper secrets
Make lore feel lived-in, not just exposition
Balance grandeur with intimacy in storytelling
